## Useful Info

**Stone golems** are the quintessential golems -- big, slow, and tough. They're hardier than [clay golems](/Clay_golem "Clay golem"), but not as tough as [iron](/Iron_golem "Iron golem") or [crystal golems](/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem").

### Variant Stone Golem

[![Vine-covered golem.png](/images/8/80/Vine-covered_golem.png)](/File:Vine-covered_golem.png) You can find **vine-covered golems** guarding an altar to [Fedhas Madash](/Fedhas_Madash "Fedhas Madash") in [Eringya's Formal Garden](/Eringya%27s_Formal_Garden "Eringya's Formal Garden").

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | While made of ordinary old weathered stone, covered with moss and vines, this golem still needs to be respected. It is still as hard as stone, after all, and its weight spells massive damage if it connects a blow. |

## Tips & Tricks

- Mid-level melee-focused characters wearing decent armour can probably engage them directly without too much trouble, though they may wish to buff themselves by drinking a [potion of might](/Potion_of_might "Potion of might") or going [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk").
- Stone golems are big and tough, but they're also slow. Kiting them works well, especially for more fragile characters, and you can always run away if you start taking a beating.
- Casters should try to use non-elemental [Conjurations](/Conjuration "Conjuration") or [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") to take them down, since they resist elemental attacks and are completely immune to [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes").

## History

Stone golems were removed in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14")

A huge, magically animated statue made of incredibly hard basalt.

“I see him there
Bringing a stone grasped firmly by the top
In each hand, like an old-stone savage armed.”
-Robert Frost, “Mending Wall”, _North of Boston_. 1914

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
    • 1.1 Variant Stone Golem
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 History

Useful Info

Stone golems are the quintessential golems -- big, slow, and tough. They're hardier than clay golems, but not as tough as iron or crystal golems.

Variant Stone Golem

You can find vine-covered golems guarding an altar to Fedhas Madash in Eringya's Formal Garden.

While made of ordinary old weathered stone, covered with moss and vines, this golem still needs to be respected. It is still as hard as stone, after all, and its weight spells massive damage if it connects a blow.

Tips & Tricks

  • Mid-level melee-focused characters wearing decent armour can probably engage them directly without too much trouble, though they may wish to buff themselves by drinking a potion of might or going berserk.
  • Stone golems are big and tough, but they're also slow. Kiting them works well, especially for more fragile characters, and you can always run away if you start taking a beating.
  • Casters should try to use non-elemental Conjurations or Earth Magic to take them down, since they resist elemental attacks and are completely immune to Hexes.

History

Stone golems were removed in 0.14
